alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 8:53PM MDT until June 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday. Between 6 and 12 hours of single digit relative humidity readings are expected in the Middle Rio Grande Valley with a few hours possible elsewhere. Gusty westerly winds are expected each afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...The Red Flag Warning includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and Central Highlands (Zone 125) Friday afternoon and evening and the Fire Weather Watch includes the same areas Saturday afternoon and evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 mph each afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 6 to 10 percent each afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
